alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 2:29AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Cherry, western Brown and western Keya Paha Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 229 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sicangu Village to 9 miles southwest of Brownlee. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Valentine, Johnstown, Brownlee, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Elsmere, Norden, Crookston, Wood Lake, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Moon Lake, North River Trail, Sparks, Willow Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Long Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 83 crossing the North Loup River, Smith Falls State Park, Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Antelope Peak, Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River and Giant Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 184 and 239. Highway 97 between mile markers 103 and 107, and between mile markers 114 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 158 and 222. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 39, and between mile markers 41 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Western Cherry
